history.acquisition: From printed books and manuscripts unless otherwise specified: the source is not recorded in many cases.

recordHist.source: Adapted (Nov. 2021) from a typescript description (n.d.; mid-20th century) compiled by Bodleian Library staff Summary Catalogue, Vol. 5, p. 832

history.provenance: From MS. Add. C. 146, which belonged to the Cistercian abbey of Aulne.

decoDesc.decoNote: Including part of a zoomorphic initial.
Smaller plain initials in green, red, and blue.

history.provenance: From 8o M. 57 Th. A bifolium from the same manuscript is Cambridge, Corpus Christi College, MS. 485, nos. 51, 52: N. Ker, Pastedowns in Oxford Bindings, nos. 1559, 1605.

msItem.title: Psalter
msItem.bibl: N. Ker, Pastedowns in Oxford Bindings, no. 1555

decoDesc.decoNote: Alternating 1-line initials in blue and red.

msItem.title: Epistles of St Paul (Colossians) with gloss of Peter Lombard

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
msItem.title: Magna Glossatura on St Paul's Epistles, Coloss. 2.1-12

history.acquisition: Removed from Auct. T. V. 19 in 1883.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initial in blue, rose, gold, and white.
Border in blue, rose, gold, and white.

acquisition.q: Sent anonymously by post to the Bodleian from London, 2 Nov. 1891

listBibl.bibl: Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library Oxford, III (1974) no. 641

history.provenance: Formerly the wrapper of MS. Laud Misc. 66 (rebound in 1919), from the Jesuit College, Würzburg

supportDesc.extent: 12 leaves and a fragment; fols. 22-5, 26, 27, 28, 29, 31, 32 are consecutive leaves

decoDesc.decoNote: 9-line arabesque initial in green and red (fol. 23r) and red (fol. 31v)

history.acquisition: From the binding of Auct. III Q inf II 20-21.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2-line initials in alternating red and blue with penwork in the contrasting colour.

history.provenance: per me Andream Gerthe the , 16th century, partly erased, fol. 38r.

msItem.title: Pauline Epistles with gloss (interlinear (?)), II Cor. 12.10-21, II Cor. 13.3-end, Gal. 1.1-4
Bible, list of Ammonian sections (109-214) from St John's Gospel, Eusebian canons

history.provenance: From MS. Bodl. 868, a manuscript from Worcester cathedral priory.

history.acquisition: From the binding of EE 2 Art Seld.

history.provenance: Formerly the cover of Statuta Pistoriensia, Bowyer 16

msItem.title: Pauline Epistles with interlinear gloss only, Hebrews 1.13 - 2.16, 7.5-25
Luke 7.12-22, 8.49 - 9.4, reject leaves with space left for gloss

history.acquisition: Formerly the cover of 8o R 56 Mrf.

decoDesc.decoNote: Initial in blue, red and green.
Puzzle initial in blue and red with flourishing in both colours.

history.acquisition: Removed from MS. Auct. E. 1. 9 in 1881.

msItem.title: Copy of initial from British Library Harley MS. 2799 fol. 173v.
Gospels, Matthew 4.9-16, 4.24-56
msItem.note: See T. A. M. Bishop in Nordisk Tidskrift 54 (1971), 39-40, no. 5

msItem.title: Bible
msItem.note: Two fragments forming the upper part of a leaf from a large Bible, Joshua 24.3 - Judges 2.17

layoutDesc.layout: 2 columns; a complete column probably had c. 65-66 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Large initial in red and blue with pen flourishing.

history.provenance: From the binding of Erasmus, Paraphrasim (1534) [Antiq.f.GS.1534.1-2]; given by F. Weatherhead & Son of Aylesbury, 1970.
